decks.notes: This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's strategy while maintaining a strong aggressive presence on the battlefield. By utilizing cards like Force of Negation and Subtlety to control the board, while also deploying powerful creatures like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Emperor of Bones to pressure your opponent, you can quickly overwhelm them and secure victory. Teferi, Time Raveler provides additional disruption and protection, while cards like Consign to Memory and Fatal Push offer versatile removal options. Utilizing a mix of control elements and aggressive threats, this deck aims to outmaneuver and outpace the opponent for a decisive win.

The deck focuses on utilizing low-cost aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It also includes instant and sorcery spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to control the game and clear the way for its creatures. The deck aims to win the game quickly with a combination of efficient creatures and burn spells, overwhelming the opponent before they can stabilize. It also includes cards like Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration to provide card advantage and ensure a consistent stream of threats.

The deck focuses on using instant reanimator effects to quickly bring powerful creatures like Griselbrand back from the graveyard for quick and unexpected wins. It utilizes cards like Goryo's Vengeance and fallaji Archaeologist to combo off and establish a strong board presence. The inclusion of counter magic like Force of Negation and disruption like Thoughtseize helps to protect the combo and disrupt opponents' strategies. Additionally, the deck includes a mix of lands to support the color requirements of the spells and creatures, ensuring a consistent and efficient play experience.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively play low-cost cards to deal damage to the opponent, while using cards like Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration to dig for more resources. Utilizing creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler, along with burn spells such as Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize. The inclusion of Violent Urge and Mutagenic Growth provides additional damage and protection, allowing the deck to maintain pressure and close out the game swiftly.

This deck is focused on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells to control the board and deal damage efficiently. The key strategy is to play low-cost creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu early on, supported by removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Consign to Memory. The Leyline cards and Leyline Binding help to boost the power of the creatures and protect them from removal. With a mix of creatures, burn spells, and land support, this deck aims to quickly defeat opponents before they have a chance to respond effectively.

This deck focuses on efficiently deploying low-cost artifacts to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. By utilizing cards like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum, along with powerful creatures like Memnite and Ornithopter, the deck aims to quickly build a strong board presence and apply pressure early in the game. The inclusion of cards like Shadowspear and Lavaspur Boots provide additional ways to enhance the deck's aggression, while cards like Engineered Explosives and Tormod's Crypt offer disruption and removal options to control the battlefield.

This deck focuses on utilizing the card Birthing Ritual to quickly ramp up mana and cast powerful Simic creatures early in the game. By playing cards like Shardless Agent and Coiling Oracle, the deck is able to maintain card advantage and consistently put pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures. The inclusion of counterspells like Force of Negation and Flare of Denial helps protect the board state and disrupt the opponent's plays. Overall, the deck aims to quickly establish a dominant board presence and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creature plays.

This deck aims to control the game by utilizing the powerful UrzaTron lands to ramp up mana quickly. Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, Eye of the Storms are key cards in this strategy, allowing for disruption and removal of threats. Thought-Knot Seer and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger provide additional ways to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Devourer of Destiny and Kozilek's Command offer additional versatility and options for dealing with threats. Overall, the deck focuses on resource management and control to dominate the game.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with cards like Birthing Ritual and Coiling Oracle to play powerful creatures and spells ahead of schedule. It also utilizes cards like Subtlety, Endurance, and Force of Negation to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck combines aggro elements with control elements, using creatures like Shardless Agent and Ice-Fang Coatl for offense while also having counterspells and removal spells like Sink into Stupor and Dismember for defense. The aim is to overwhelm the opponent with strong creature presence and disruptive spells.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and spells, dealing damage as efficiently as possible. Cards like Goblin Bombardment and Galvanic Discharge provide direct damage, while creatures like Voice of Victory and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury can quickly close out the game. The deck also includes cards like Thraben Charm and Solitude for removal, as well as Ajani, Nacatl Pariah for extra support. The mana base is optimized for consistent casting of spells and creatures to maintain pressure on the opponent.

This deck focuses on generating mana quickly and efficiently to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End using cards like Grove of the Burnwillows, Eldrazi Temple, and Urza's Saga. It also utilizes various support cards such as Walking Ballista, Kozilek's Command, and Malevolent Rumble to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Writhing Chrysalis and Glaring Fleshraker to provide additional threats and pressure the opponent. Overall, the goal is to assemble key pieces quickly and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and disruptive spells.

The deck focuses on using instant effects to reanimate powerful creatures from the graveyard, creating explosive combos and overwhelming the opponent with strong board presence. It utilizes cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate to bring back creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Griselbrand quickly and efficiently. The deck also includes disruption spells like Force of Negation and Thoughtseize to control the game and protect its combo pieces. Overall, the strategy revolves around leveraging powerful instant reanimation effects to create a swift and formidable advantage on the battlefield.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly and efficiently using rituals and mana-fixing spells to cast powerful spells like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Past in Flames. It aims to chain together spells and generate a storm count to win the game with a massive Grapeshot or by overwhelming the opponent with burn spells. The deck also includes cards like Wrenn's Resolve and Wish to tutor for combo pieces and protect its key cards. The combination of mana acceleration, card draw, and protection allows the deck to quickly assemble its combo and win the game.

This deck focuses on aggressively utilizing creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, Scion of Draco, and Territorial Kavu to quickly overwhelm the opponent. Its main strategy is to control the game with cards like Leyline Binding and Leyline of the Guildpact, while utilizing burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Prismatic Ending to maintain board control. The deck also includes strong counterspells like Stubborn Denial and versatile removal options like Consign to Memory. With a mix of efficient creatures, removal, and disruption, this deck aims to establish dominance and control the pace of the game from the start.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying artifacts and generating value through cards like Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal. It uses cheap artifact creatures like Memnite and Pinnacle Emissary to apply pressure on the opponent. Urza's Saga provides additional artifact synergy by tutoring for powerful artifacts like Engineered Explosives or Shadowspear. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Thought Monitor provide card advantage and additional recursion. The deck can also disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Tormod's Crypt and Metallic Rebuke. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient artifact creatures and synergies.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, hand disruption, and removal spells. This deck aims to control the board and limit the opponent's options by using cards like Preordain, Thoughtseize, and Force of Negation. It also includes cards like Murktide Regent and Quantum Riddler to provide threats and close out the game once the opponent's resources are depleted. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Psychic Frog provide card advantage and additional control elements to outmaneuver the opponent.
